long: Meaning: the "lip" (as a natural boundary); by implication, "language"; by analogy, a "margin" (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.).  Usage: band, bank, binding, border, brim, brink, edge, language, lip, prating, (sea-)shore, side, speech, talk, (vain) words.  Source: or (in dual and plural) "שֶׂפֶת"; probably from "H5595" or "H8192" through the idea of "termination" (compare "H5490");
